newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Melbourne Airport buy mostly debt-funded - BAA.
newsitem.headline: Melbourne Airport buy mostly debt-funded - BAA.

text.p: Australia Pacific Airports Corp Ltd (APA), the consortium which has been awarded the long-term lease of Melbourne Airport, said on Wednesday it would provide A$345 million in equity with the rest funded by borrowing facilities.
The Australian government said earlier that APA would pay A$1.307 billion for Melbourne Airport.
BAA Plc, the leader of the consortium, would have an initial stake of 25.1 percent in APA and would make a capital contribution of A$53 million.
BAA's stake would fall to 15.1 percent if a proposed fourth partner, Melbourne-based Hastings Funds Management, exercised its option to take a 10 percent stake.
The other APA partners are the Australian Mutual Provident Society (AMP) with a 49.9 percent holding and Sydney-based funds manager Axiom with 25.0 percent.
Axiom was last week sold to Deutsche Morgan Grenfell by the New South Wales government for A$240 million.
